blocks.text: An attack vector is the method used by an attacker to gain access to a system, while the attack surface is the total set of points where an attacker could attempt entry.
Reducing the attack surface limits opportunities for exploitation, even when vulnerabilities exist.
Security teams focus on identifying exposed services, user behaviors, and third-party integrations that expand potential entry points.
Many attacks combine multiple vectors, such as social engineering followed by malware installation.
